# ADP Real and Imaginary Indices
#
# 0.2 to 2 um real indices from Zernike 1964, Table 7
# 'Refractive Indices of Ammonium Dihydrogen Phosphate and Potassium Dihydrogen Phosphate between 2000 Å and 1.5 μ'
# Indices are extrapolated from 1.15 um to 2 um
# I took the absolute indices and averaged the ordinary and extraordinary ray indices based on direction ((2/3*n_o + 1/3*n_e)
# I take the 0.2 to 2 um imginary to be 0 since ADP crystals are used to 
# make lasers, and therefore have negliable attenuation in the wavelengths
# that they are used to make industry grade lasers
# Additionally, I discluded the 2 um point in lieu of the 2 um point of the next dataset
#
# 2-20 um real and imaginary from Querry 1974, Table 2 (aqueous solution)
# 'Optical constants in the infrared for K2SO4, NH4H2PO4 , and H2SO4 in water'
#
0.2 1.628629 0.0
0.3 1.546892 0.0
0.4 1.524722 0.0
0.5 1.514778 0.0
0.6 1.508976 0.0
0.7 1.504908 0.0
0.8 1.501634 0.0
0.9 1.498724 0.0
1.0 1.495956 0.0
1.1 1.493206 0.0
1.2 1.4904 0.0
1.3 1.487491 0.0
1.4 1.484446 0.0
1.5 1.481243 0.0
1.6 1.477867 0.0
1.7 1.474304 0.0
1.8 1.470545 0.0
1.9 1.466582 0.0
2.0 1.462407 0.0
2.20 1.306 0.0 
2.40 1.292 0.0
